intro: Bunium creticum, commonly known as the Cretan fennel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in umbels. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. Bunium creticum is characterized by its strong, spicy aroma and its ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils.
